books.author: George Orwell
books.summary: Set in a dystopian society ruled by totalitarian government, 1984 follows Winston Smith as he navigates a world of oppression, surveillance, and propaganda. As Winston questions the Party's control, he risks his life to explore forbidden thoughts and a rebellious love affair, leading to a tragic realization of the extent of the regime's power.

books.title: The Maze Runner
books.author: James Dashner
books.summary: In a post-apocalyptic world, a group of teenagers is trapped in a mysterious maze with no memory of how they arrived. Thomas, the protagonist, becomes entangled in their efforts to escape, facing deadly creatures, and uncovering secrets that may change the fate of humanity.

books.title: The Hunger Games
books.author: Suzanne Collins
books.summary: Set in a dystopian future, The Hunger Games follows Katniss Everdeen, a young girl who volunteers to take her sister's place in a deadly televised competition. As Katniss navigates the brutal games, she becomes a symbol of resistance and rebellion against the oppressive Capitol.

books.title: The Hobbit
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.summary: Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit, is swept into an epic adventure when he joins a group of dwarves on a quest to reclaim their homeland from the dragon Smaug. Along the way, Bilbo encounters trolls, goblins, and a mysterious creature named Gollum, testing his courage and resourcefulness.

books.title: Fahrenheit 451
books.author: Ray Bradbury
books.summary: In a society where books are banned and critical thought is suppressed, fireman Guy Montag is tasked with burning any remaining literature. However, as Montag questions the status quo, he embarks on a dangerous journey to preserve knowledge and challenge the oppressive regime.

books.title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
books.author: J.K. Rowling
books.summary: Harry Potter, a young boy raised by neglectful relatives, discovers he is a wizard on his 11th birthday. At Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, Harry makes friends, unravels the mystery of his parents' death, and confronts the dark wizard Voldemort in his quest for the Philosopher's Stone.

books.title: Moby-Dick
books.author: Herman Melville
books.summary: The novel follows Ishmael, a sailor who joins the whaling ship Pequod led by the obsessive Captain Ahab. Ahab's singular focus is to hunt down the legendary white whale, Moby Dick, leading to a journey filled with existential reflection, danger, and a tragic outcome.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.summary: Pride and Prejudice centers on Elizabeth Bennet and her evolving relationship with the aloof Mr. Darcy. The novel explores themes of love, social expectations, and the prejudices that shape human behavior, leading to a deeper understanding of self and others.

books.title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.summary: Frodo Baggins is entrusted with the task of destroying the One Ring, an ancient artifact with the power to rule the world. Joined by a fellowship of friends and allies, Frodo embarks on an epic journey through Middle-earth, facing dangerous enemies and temptations along the way.

books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.summary: Set during the Roaring Twenties, The Great Gatsby tells the story of Jay Gatsby, a wealthy and mysterious man who throws extravagant parties at his mansion in West Egg. Through the eyes of Nick Carraway, a young man who moves in next door, the novel explores Gatsby's obsessive love for Daisy Buchanan, a woman he met and fell in love with years earlier. Gatsby's relentless pursuit of Daisy, despite her marriage to Tom Buchanan, leads to tragedy. The book delves into themes of love, wealth, class, and the American Dream, offering a critique of the illusions people chase.

books.title: The Outsiders
books.author: S.E. Hinton
books.summary: The Outsiders is the story of Ponyboy Curtis, a 14-year-old boy growing up in a lower-class neighborhood in Tulsa, Oklahoma. Ponyboy belongs to a group of friends known as the Greasers, who often clash with the wealthier Socs. The novel chronicles Ponyboy's struggles with identity, class conflict, and family. After a violent altercation with a Soc named Bob, Ponyboy and his friend Johnny run away, leading to a series of tragic events. The story explores themes of friendship, loyalty, and the search for belonging.

books.title: The Alchemist
books.author: Paulo Coelho
books.summary: The story follows Santiago, a young shepherd from Spain, on a journey to discover his personal legend and the meaning of life. Through his travels, he learns profound lessons about fate, destiny, and the importance of following oneâ€™s dreams.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.summary: The novel follows Holden Caulfield, a disenchanted teenager who has been expelled from prep school. As he wanders New York City, Holden grapples with the adult world, identity, and his desire to protect the innocence of children.

books.title: Brave New World
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.summary: 'Brave New World' depicts a futuristic society where human beings are engineered in hatcheries, conditioned for specific roles, and kept in line through a drug that dulls emotions. The novel explores themes of social control, technology, and individual freedom.

books.title: Crime and Punishment
books.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
books.summary: The novel follows Rodion Raskolnikov, a young student who believes that certain people are above moral laws. After committing a crime, he struggles with guilt, madness, and the consequences of his actions, grappling with deep philosophical questions of morality.

books.title: The Da Vinci Code
books.author: Dan Brown
books.summary: A gripping thriller that follows Robert Langdon, a Harvard symbologist, as he uncovers a trail of cryptic puzzles tied to the secrets of the Catholic Church. As he tries to solve the mystery of a murder in the Louvre, Langdon discovers a conspiracy that spans centuries.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.summary: Set in the 1930s South, this novel follows Scout Finch, a young girl, as she learns about racism, injustice, and compassion through her father, Atticus Finch, a lawyer defending a black man accused of raping a white woman.

books.title: One of Us Is Lying
books.author: Karen M. McManus
books.summary: Five students walk into detention, but only four walk out alive. As the story unfolds, secrets, lies, and betrayals emerge among the four remaining suspects, each with a motive to murder the student who died.

books.title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
books.author: J.K. Rowling
books.summary: A young boy, Harry Potter, discovers that he is a wizard and attends the Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. Along with his friends, he uncovers the mystery surrounding his parentsâ€™ death and a dark force that threatens the wizarding world.

books.title: Little Women
books.author: Louisa May Alcott
books.summary: This heartwarming tale follows the lives of the four March sistersâ€”Meg, Jo, Beth, and Amyâ€”as they navigate their coming-of-age journey during the American Civil War, focusing on family, love, loss, and dreams of the future.

books.title: Great Expectations
books.author: Charles Dickens
books.summary: This heartwarming tale follows the lives of the four March sistersâ€”Meg, Jo, Beth, and Amyâ€”as they navigate their coming-of-age journey during the American Civil War, focusing on family, love, loss, and dreams of the future.

books.title: Lord of the Flies
books.author: William Golding
books.summary: A group of boys stranded on an uninhabited island descend into savagery as their attempts at civilization collapse. The novel explores the darkness of human nature and the consequences of the breakdown of social order.

books.title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A whimsical comedy where love, magic, and mischief intertwine in a magical forest. The play follows four Athenian lovers and a group of actors who are manipulated by fairies, resulting in a series of humorous misunderstandings and transformations.

books.title: Othello
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: Othello, a Moorish general in the Venetian army, is manipulated by his envious ensign, Iago, who plants seeds of doubt in Othello's mind about his wife Desdemonaâ€™s fidelity, leading to tragic consequences.

books.title: The Little Prince
books.author: Antoine de Saint-ExupÃ©ry
books.summary: A young prince travels from planet to planet, meeting various inhabitants who impart lessons on life and love. Through his journey, he learns that the most important things are invisible to the eyes and only understood through the heart.

books.title: The Diary of Anne Frank
books.author: Anne Frank
books.summary: Four siblings are transported to the magical land of Narnia, where they meet the noble lion Aslan and join the fight against the evil White Witch. The novel is an allegory of good versus evil and a tale of bravery, friendship, and redemption.

books.title: Jane Eyre
books.author: Charlotte BrontÃ«
books.summary: Jane Eyre, an orphan, rises from a harsh childhood to become a governess at Thornfield Hall. There, she falls in love with the enigmatic Mr. Rochester, but dark secrets threaten to tear them apart.

books.title: Dracula
books.author: Bram Stoker
books.summary: The Gothic horror novel tells the tale of Count Draculaâ€™s attempt to move from Transylvania to England to spread the undead curse. It follows a group of characters as they try to stop him, exploring themes of sexuality, fear, and evil.

books.title: Alice's Adventures in Wonderland
books.author: Lewis Carroll
books.summary: Alice, a curious young girl, falls through a rabbit hole into a fantastical world where she meets a variety of eccentric characters. Her adventures challenge logic and reason, and the story is a delightful exploration of imagination.

books.title: War and Peace
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.summary: A sweeping historical novel set against the backdrop of Napoleonâ€™s invasion of Russia, it follows the lives of several aristocratic families as they navigate the personal and political turmoil of the era. Themes of fate, free will, and love are explored.

books.title: Catch-22
books.author: Joseph Heller
books.summary: This darkly comedic novel tells the story of Captain John Yossarian, a World War II bombardier, who becomes desperate to escape the war. The absurdity of military bureaucracy and the paradox of the Catch-22 rule (that soldiers who want to be grounded are considered sane and must fly) form the heart of this critique of war and authority.

books.title: Peter Pan
books.author: J.M. Barrie
books.summary: Peter Pan, the mischievous boy who never grows up, takes Wendy Darling and her brothers on a magical adventure to Neverland, where they battle pirates and encounter fairies. Itâ€™s a story of adventure, imagination, and the joy of childhood innocence.

books.title: Brave New World
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.summary: The novel imagines a future where people are artificially produced and conditioned for their roles in society. It explores the loss of individuality in a world that prioritizes stability and happiness at any cost.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.summary: summary

books.title: A Game of Thrones
books.author: George R.R. Martin
books.summary: In a brutal medieval fantasy world, noble families vie for control of the Iron Throne of the Seven Kingdoms. Betrayal, alliances, and dangerous political intrigue drive the plot, with the looming threat of winter and the supernatural dangers beyond the Wall.

books.title: The Shining
books.author: Stephen King
books.summary: Jack Torrance, a writer with a troubled past, accepts a job as the winter caretaker of the isolated Overlook Hotel. As the harsh winter sets in, Jack's sanity deteriorates under the influence of supernatural forces, putting his wife and son at risk.

books.title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
books.author: C.S. Lewis
books.summary: Four siblings are transported to the magical land of Narnia, where they meet the noble lion Aslan and join the fight against the evil White Witch. The novel is an allegory of good versus evil and a tale of bravery, friendship, and redemption.

genres.name: Dystopian
genres.description: A genre that explores societies characterized by extreme levels of control, surveillance, or oppression.

genres.name: Fantasy
genres.description: A genre that involves magical or supernatural elements and often takes place in imaginary worlds.

genres.name: Adventure
genres.description: A genre that focuses on exciting, risky, and often dangerous experiences or journeys.

genres.name: Romance
genres.description: A genre centered on romantic relationships, typically focusing on love and emotional connections.

genres.name: Classic
genres.description: A genre that refers to timeless and widely recognized works of literature.

genres.name: Young Adult
genres.description: A genre that targets a young adult audience, often featuring teenage protagonists facing emotional or social struggles.

genres.name: Gothic
genres.description: A genre that often includes dark, mysterious settings with themes of horror, decay, and the supernatural.

genres.name: Thriller
genres.description: A genre that uses suspense, tension, and excitement to keep readers on edge, often involving crime or danger.

genres.name: Mystery
genres.description: A genre focused on solving a crime, puzzle, or enigma, typically through investigation or detective work.

genres.name: Southern Gothic
genres.description: A genre that includes elements of gothic fiction, often set in the American South, with themes of decay and social issues.

genres.name: Bildungsroman
genres.description: A genre focused on the coming-of-age story, following the protagonist's personal growth and development.

genres.name: Allegorical Novel
genres.description: A genre in which characters, events, or settings symbolize deeper moral, political, or philosophical meanings.

genres.name: Psychological Fiction
genres.description: A genre that explores the psychological and emotional states of characters, often focusing on inner conflicts.

genres.name: Comedy
genres.description: A genre that emphasizes humor, often with lighthearted or satirical themes.

genres.name: Tragedy
genres.description: A genre that explores human suffering, often with a dark, serious tone and inevitable downfall of characters.

genres.name: Novella
genres.description: A shorter form of fiction, often more focused in scope than a full-length novel.

genres.name: Autobiography
genres.description: A genre where the author tells the story of their own life, often from a personal perspective.

genres.name: Holocaust Literature
genres.description: A genre that deals with the historical events of the Holocaust, often focusing on survivors' stories and memories.

genres.name: Horror
genres.description: A genre intended to provoke fear, dread, and suspense, often featuring supernatural or grotesque elements.

genres.name: Historical Fiction
genres.description: A genre that takes place in the past, often blending fictional events with historical settings.

genres.name: Satire
genres.description: A genre that uses humor, irony, and exaggeration to criticize or mock societal norms or issues.

genres.name: War Fiction
genres.description: A genre that deals with the effects and experiences of war, often focusing on soldiers and their emotional struggles.

genres.name: Coming-of-age
genres.description: A genre that centers around a character's transition from youth to adulthood, often dealing with personal challenges.
